channel.title: BCEL - Setting a public variable with a added method

item.title: BCEL - Setting a public variable with a added method
item.dc:creator: @Pker Pker
item.description:
@Pker wrote:

Yea at first i thought an updater only injected the same code when a new runescape.jar was released.
So it was just like only insert the same methods you generated all the time, but lol i did mistake that.

I did learn alot, and still needs to figure out how to create a real updater ,and it seems that this is the hard job: Creating a application that finds the variables to use, then create the simple methods.

Read full topic
item.source: BCEL - Setting a public variable with a added method

item.title: BCEL - Setting a public variable with a added method
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Everything does change, the whole purpose behind having an updater.

Pker:

lol im fucked then … all that work for nothing duh

At least you learned something, right?

item.source: BCEL - Setting a public variable with a added method

item.title: BCEL - Setting a public variable with a added method
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Pker, post:15, topic:255812”][quote author=nueb35 link=topic=337995.msg2625021#msg2625021 date=1231722771]
you’re a bit confused about what an updater does.
[/quote]

I’m fully aware of that my “updater” does not dynamically get fields, but mine is rather static.
But say a new version of RS comes out, it isn’t 100 % that the class/variable name changed is it ?

Like example: “na.eb” would not change to “cd.wd” right ? in any case i mean[/quote]Yes, all variables get renamed.

Read full topic

I’m fully aware of that my “updater” does not dynamically get fields, but mine is rather static.
But say a new version of RS comes out, it isn’t 100 % that the class/variable name changed is it ?

Like example: “na.eb” would not change to “cd.wd” right ? in any case i mean

item.title: BCEL - Setting a public variable with a added method
item.dc:creator: @Pker Pker
item.description:
@Pker wrote:

Yuppie, but Qauters does not release his updater, so when a new verison of runescape comes out , it will be outdated and it cannot be used, so with my updater i can easly get it to run again. ( I dont want to rely on Qauters all the time )

Read full topic
item.source: BCEL - Setting a public variable with a added method

item.title: BCEL - Setting a public variable with a added method
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

you do know that all those methods are already in rsbot, all you need to do is [tt]Bot.getClient()[/tt] and it will return an instance of client, from which you can access all the other methods.

Read full topic
item.source: BCEL - Setting a public variable with a added method

item.title: BCEL - Setting a public variable with a added method
item.dc:creator: @Pker Pker
item.description:
@Pker wrote:

I got the field names from before ( from quaters rs.jar file ). So i only make bcel code to add these fields and etc.

It generally looks like this:
The script is about 1000 lines of code for now

addSimpleReturn("sg","cb","getSelectedItemName",cGen,Constants.ACC_FINAL | Constants.ACC_PUBLIC,"Lcom.speljohan.rsbot.accessors.RSString;"); addSimpleReturn("ch","z","spellUsableOn",cGen,Constants.ACC_FINAL | Constants.ACC_PUBLIC); addSimpleReturn("kd","H","getSelectedSpellName",cGen,Constants.ACC_FINAL | Constants.ACC_PUBLIC,"Lcom.speljohan.rsbot.accessors.RSString;"); addSimpleReturn("ea","Y","getItemDefMRUNodes",cGen,Constants.ACC_FINAL | Constants.ACC_PUBLIC,"Lcom.speljohan.rsbot.accessors.MRUNodes;"); addSimpleReturn("mg","j","getObjectDefMRUNodes",cGen,Constants.ACC_FINAL | Constants.ACC_PUBLIC,"Lcom.speljohan.rsbot.accessors.MRUNodes;"); addSimpleReturn("al","o","isMembers",cGen,Constants.ACC_FINAL | Constants.ACC_PUBLIC);

Read full topic
item.source: BCEL - Setting a public variable with a added method

item.source: BCEL - Setting a public variable with a added method

item.title: BCEL - Setting a public variable with a added method
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Pker, post:1, topic:255812”]Okay , im at my last parts of finishing my “own” updater!

so im trying to create a callback function like this: ( Where my bot is going to get set the callback variable in client.class… )
public final void setCallback(Callback arg0)
{
callback = arg0;
}


What i have so far with my code is:

public final void setCallback(Callback arg0)
{
    callback;
}

I have created the callback field myself in to client.class like this: ( this works , but im just showing you guys so you know what im talking about )

                  // Add public variable "callback".
                  cGen.addField(new FieldGen(Constants.ACC_PUBLIC | Constants.ACC_STATIC, new ObjectType("com.speljohan.rsbot.accessors.Callback"), "callback", cPoolGen).getField());

And now with this code… it generates abit wrong method as you can see on the above!


                  // Add public void setCallback(Callback callback);
                  InstructionList il = new InstructionList();
                  MethodGen  mg = new MethodGen(Constants.ACC_FINAL | Constants.ACC_PUBLIC, // access flags
                                Type.VOID,               // return type
                                new Type[] {             // argument types
                                  Type.getType("Lcom.speljohan.rsbot.accessors.Callback;") },
                                new String[] { "arg0" }, // arg names
                                "setCallback", "client",    // method, class
                                il, cPoolGen);
                  LocalVariableGen lg = mg.addLocalVariable("callback", Type.getType("Lcom.speljohan.rsbot.accessors.Callback;"), null, null);
                  
                  InstructionFactory iFact = new InstructionFactory(cGen,cPoolGen);
                  Instruction pushThis = new ALOAD(0);
                  Instruction ourinstruction = iFact.createFieldAccess("client","callback",Type.getType("Lcom.speljohan.rsbot.accessors.Callback;"),Constants.GETSTATIC);
                  il.append(ourinstruction);
                  il.append(new ALOAD(0)); // load ctx
                  il.append(new ALOAD(1)); // load ctx
                  mg.setMaxStack();
                  mg.setMaxLocals();
		  mg.removeLineNumbers();
                  cGen.addMethod(mg.getMethod());

Does anyone know what to change in my code, i have been trying for 4 hours now
++++++++++++++++++REP to anyone that can help![/quote]I’m curious, what is this for, seeing how it’s obviously related to rsbot.

Read full topic
item.source: BCEL - Setting a public variable with a added method

item.title: BCEL - Setting a public variable with a added method
item.dc:creator: @Pker Pker
item.description:
@Pker wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:2, topic:255812”]you want the instructionlist to look something like

aload_0
aload_1
putfield[/quote]

Do you know how to implement this into this code i posted above? I have not really understand how to add instruction, if you add it it would be great so i can learn of it.

Edit: I managed to test my self into it… after 5 hours yay! complete.

Read full topic

item.title: BCEL - Setting a public variable with a added method
item.dc:creator: @Pker Pker
item.description:
@Pker wrote:

Okay , im at my last parts of finishing my “own” updater!

so im trying to create a callback function like this: ( Where my bot is going to get set the callback variable in client.class… )
public final void setCallback(Callback arg0)
{
callback = arg0;
}


What i have so far with my code is:

public final void setCallback(Callback arg0)
{
    callback;
}

I have created the callback field myself in to client.class like this: ( this works , but im just showing you guys so you know what im talking about )

                  // Add public variable "callback".
                  cGen.addField(new FieldGen(Constants.ACC_PUBLIC | Constants.ACC_STATIC, new ObjectType("com.speljohan.rsbot.accessors.Callback"), "callback", cPoolGen).getField());

And now with this code… it generates abit wrong method as you can see on the above!


                  // Add public void setCallback(Callback callback);
                  InstructionList il = new InstructionList();
                  MethodGen  mg = new MethodGen(Constants.ACC_FINAL | Constants.ACC_PUBLIC, // access flags
                                Type.VOID,               // return type
                                new Type[] {             // argument types
                                  Type.getType("Lcom.speljohan.rsbot.accessors.Callback;") },
                                new String[] { "arg0" }, // arg names
                                "setCallback", "client",    // method, class
                                il, cPoolGen);
                  LocalVariableGen lg = mg.addLocalVariable("callback", Type.getType("Lcom.speljohan.rsbot.accessors.Callback;"), null, null);
                  
                  InstructionFactory iFact = new InstructionFactory(cGen,cPoolGen);
                  Instruction pushThis = new ALOAD(0);
                  Instruction ourinstruction = iFact.createFieldAccess("client","callback",Type.getType("Lcom.speljohan.rsbot.accessors.Callback;"),Constants.GETSTATIC);
                  il.append(ourinstruction);
                  il.append(new ALOAD(0)); // load ctx
                  il.append(new ALOAD(1)); // load ctx
                  mg.setMaxStack();
                  mg.setMaxLocals();
		  mg.removeLineNumbers();
                  cGen.addMethod(mg.getMethod());

Does anyone know what to change in my code, i have been trying for 4 hours now
++++++++++++++++++REP to anyone that can help!

Read full topic
